review_title: Don't expect any information regarding your future
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Wales, PA
pros: Good salary. nice campus. Overall clean facility with high standards of care
cons: Overall it has been a good company to work for until recently. they are selling the building and won't tell anyone so no body has any idea if they are keeping their job or what will happen. they are only looking out for themselves at this point so that everyone won't quit but don't care if we all end up losing our job in the long run. hard to trust a company that will do that do its employees

review_title: Practice what they Preach, Values and Relationships
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Wales, PA
pros: Most of the employees are friendly towards each other and willing to help their co-workers when needed.  The residents families are terrific to the workers (the aides specifically) and very involved with their loved ones life there.
cons: Lack of communication between management/supervisors and the staff is horrible especially when you are in the healthcare industry. Management constantly looks for reasons to write up employees excessively where it affects the employees job performance.

pros: Great, flexible rules- if you bring a note on the day you return after using PTO then the absence is excused- no questions.  Never, ever saw that anywhere I worked.  Good pay. Mutual respect among staff.
cons: Entitled staff- they get free transportation, great benefits ( at a low cost) and access to senior leadership with any issues, the company even subsidizes employee meals!  20 PTO days to start, and fun employee recognition events every month- there are still staff who have nothing good to say.  Crazy.

job_title: Social Services Professional in North Wales, PA
pros: Clean facility. Pleasant living conditions for residents and family.
cons: Harsh, unengaged leadership, partial to inner circle of connected employees, extremely unfair and disloyal to others. Dictate decisions without understanding, which disrupt departmental functioning and destroy morale. Favored practices include security escorts for laid off employees, many of whom are dumped after long and loyal service, once annual increases make it desire able for management to replace them with new employees.

review_title: It was  a wonderful experience working in a Jewish Facility.

job_title: Registered Nurse in North Wales, PA
cons: Hospice managers are untrustworthy.    A lot of talking about employees openly in front of others.  Lack of professionalism and leadership.  Very  Little education, appreciation to staff.   Many write ups.  Hostile and anxious envirmonment.  Employees concerns and ideas aren't heard or considered.
